explanation:
The report is correct. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 states that a function parameter shall not be modified. In read_cb, size is a value parameter (type size_t) and its address (&size) is passed to compress_buf, enabling that called function to modify the parameter object. That is a modification of the function parameter and therefore violates Rule 17.8. (By contrast, modifying the object pointed to by mem via memcpy is permitted because the rule allows modifying the object referred to by a pointer parameter, but not changing the pointer parameter itself.)

Fix: make a local copy of the parameter before passing an address (e.g. size_t local_size = size; pass &local_size), or change the API so the caller does not cause modification of the parameter variable itself.
